metadata.title: Residential Pre-Plan Check Processing Checklist
metadata.linked_from: In-House Review step-by-step (Step 7: Submit your application)
metadata.dbi_caveat: This is just DBI's checklist and other City departments may have additional requirements. Also, this checklist is only a guide as the required information and documentation may vary depending on the scope of the project.
metadata.scope: Residential projects only — no equivalent commercial checklist found

1_application_completeness.title: Application Completeness
1_application_completeness.instruction: Please complete the following portions of the permit application

3_scope_of_work.title: Scope of Work
3_scope_of_work.instruction: The scope of work has been revised to the following
checks: Identify any special programs (ADU, UDU, Affordable Housing...)
Identify floor, unit number where work takes place
Identify 'Covered Multifamily Dwelling' when applicable, bathroom option chosen

4_valuation.title: Valuation
4_valuation.instruction: The construction valuation of this project has been changed to $___

departments.name: Public Works Bureau of Streets & Mapping
Public Works Bureau of Urban Forestry

7_supporting_documentation.title: Supporting Documentation
required_items: Soils/Geotechnical report & CD ROM or flash drive
Previously approved drawings (if current permit is a revision to an issued permit)
Site survey required by a licensed land surveyor

8_plans_cover_sheet.title: Plans - Cover Sheet
requirements: All text size shall be 3/32 inch high minimum
Property information (address, lot/block, planning zone, overlay zones — flood, high fire, historical...)
Stamped and signed by a licensed architect or licensed engineer; wet signature on cover sheet
Concise, complete and accurate scope of work
List of codes the project will comply with
Drawing index with all sheets listed
Existing/changed/proposed building characteristics
Existing/changed/proposed number of stories
Existing/changed/proposed number of basements
Existing/changed/proposed type of construction
Existing/changed/proposed use and/or occupancy
Existing/changed/proposed number of dwelling units
Existing/changed/proposed floor area
Existing/changed/proposed fire sprinkler status; provide sprinkler standard (NFPA-XX, if any)
Existing/changed/proposed Type of fire alarm (if any)
List of deferred submittals
Addenda Schedule (if applicable)

9_plans_site_plan.title: Plans - Site Plan
requirements: North arrow
Property lines
All other buildings on lot and adjacent lot and use(s)
Location of Street
Applicable setbacks from property line
Location of new retaining walls and fences
NOTE: If scope of work is outside the building, provide separate existing and proposed Site Plans showing existing and proposed location of retaining wall(s), fence(s), deck(s), etc.

10_plans_architectural.title: Architectural Plans
floor_and_roof_plans: Separate existing and proposed floor & roof plans (as applicable)
Floor plans to be drawn to scale
Provide relevant dimensions, existing and proposed use for each room and/or space
Label each level as either a story or a basement; don't use vague terms (ground floor, lowest level, sub-basement, upper level, etc.)
Provide existing grade (if grade varies, provide enough data points to convey slope)
Wall/Shading legend clarifying: which walls/retaining walls are existing and to remain, which are to be removed
Hatching that clarifies the area of work/excavation; provide dimensions of the areas
Symbols, words, and notes that accurately describe the scope of the demolition
Show existing and proposed ceiling height
exterior_elevations: Symbols, words and notes that describe the scope of the remodel
Label each level as either a story or a basement (don't use vague terms)
building_cross_sections: Symbols, words and notes that describe the scope of the remodel
Label each level as either a story or a basement (don't use vague terms)

11_plans_structural.title: Structural Plans
sections_details: Label each level as either a story or a basement (don't use vague terms)

12_green_building.title: Green Building Sheets
requirements: Use the City's Green Building Standards form (referenced in AB 093) on the plans instead of a generic residential or commercial mandatory measures checklist
Clearly indicate which measures are not applicable to this project
Clearly reference plan notes, details, or the checklist itself for each measure to facilitate the plan reviewer's and inspector's review
AB-093 Attachment E (Green Building Final Compliance form) is required before Certificate of Final Completion — prepare early to avoid hold at close-out

13_title24_energy.title: Title 24 Energy Reports
requirements: Ensure all text is legible in the drawings
Ensure special features are detailed in the plan sheets
Ensure details and specifications in the plan sheets match the recommendations of the energy compliance report and vice versa

completeness_process.escalation_rule: Completeness reviews requiring 3 rounds get escalated to DBI supervisor
completeness_process.plan_review_escalation: Plan reviews requiring 3 rounds also get escalated to DBI supervisor
